messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 46 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: CSI-fingerprinting Indoor Localization via Attention-Augmented Residual Convolutional Neural Network

Paper Abstract: Abstract Deep learning has been widely adopted for channel state information (CSI)-fingerprinting indoor localization systems. These systems usually consist of two main parts, i.e., a positioning network that learns the mapping from high-dimensional CSI to physical locations and a tracking system that utilizes historical CSI to reduce the positioning error. This paper presents a new localization system with high accuracy and generality. On the one hand, the receptive field of the existing convolutional neural network (CNN)-fingerprinting positioning networks is limited, restricting their performance as useful information in CSI is not explored thoroughly. As a solution, we propose a novel attention-augmented residual CNN to utilize the local information and global context in CSI exhaustively. On the other hand, considering the generality of a tracking system, we decouple the tracking system from the CSI environments so that one tracking system for all environments becomes possible. Specifically, we remodel the tracking problem as a denoising task and solve it with deep trajectory prior. Furthermore, we investigate how the precision difference of inertial measurement units will adversely affect the tracking performance and adopt plug-and-play to solve the precision difference problem. Experiments show the superiority of our methods over existing approaches in performance and generality improvement.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 46 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 46"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "FIFS: Fine-grained indoor fingerprinting system",
        "CSI-based fingerprinting for indoor localization: A deep learning approach",
        "WiFi indoor localization with CSI fingerprinting-based random forest",
        "Deep convolutional neural networks for indoor localization with CSI images",
        "An indoor positioning method based on CSI by using features optimization mechanism with LSTM",
        "Deep convolutional neural networks for massive MIMO fingerprint-based positioning",
        "Fingerprint-based localization for massive MIMO-OFDM system with deep convolutional neural networks",
        "Improving CSI-based massive MIMO indoor positioning using convolutional neural network",
        "Intelligent indoor positioning based on artificial neural networks",
        "Understanding the effective receptive field in deep convolutional neural networks",
        "CSI fingerprinting localization with low human efforts",
        "DL-RNN: An accurate indoor localization method via double RNNs",
        "Accurate location tracking from CSI-based passive device-free probabilistic fingerprinting",
        "Sensor-aided learning for Wi-Fi positioning with beacon channel state information",
        "FreeTrack: Device-free human tracking with deep neural networks and particle filtering",
        "Performance analysis of the kalman filter with mismatched noise covariances",
        "SWiBluX: Multi-Sensor deep learning fingerprint for precise real-time indoor tracking",
        "Fine-grained indoor tracking by fusing inertial sensor and physical layer information in WLANs",
        "Step-detection and adaptive step-length estimation for pedestrian dead-reckoning at various walking speeds using a smartphone",
        "A CNN-LSTM quantifier for single access point CSI indoor localization",
        "Deep-Learning-Based Wi-Fi indoor positioning system using continuous CSI of trajectories",
        "Learning while tracking: A practical system based on variational gaussian process state-space model and smartphone sensory data",
        "A data-driven inertial navigation/bluetooth fusion algorithm for indoor localization",
        "Enhanced deep residual networks for single image super-resolution",
        "Attention augmented convolutional networks",
        "Performance assessment of the android smartphoneâ€™s IMU in a gnss/ins coupled navigation model",
        "Learning deep CNN denoiser prior for image restoration",
        "Single-site localization via maximum discrimination multipath fingerprinting",
        "Bls-location: A wireless fingerprint localization algorithm based on broad learning",
        "Learning to localize: A 3d CNN approach to user positioning in massive MIMO-OFDM systems",
        "Path planning for adaptive csi map construction with a3c in dynamic environments",
        "Drift reduction in pedestrian navigation system by exploiting motion constraints and magnetic field",
        "Accurate image super-resolution using very deep convolutional networks",
        "Deep residual learning for image recognition",
        "Refinenet: Multi-path refinement networks for high-resolution semantic segmentation",
        "RUNet: A robust UNet architecture for image super-resolution",
        "Self-Attention ConvLSTM for spatiotemporal prediction",
        "Attention is all you need",
        "An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale",
        "Self-Attention with relative position representations",
        "Plug-and-play priors for model based reconstruction",
        "Distributed optimization and statistical learning via the alternating direction method of multipliers",
        "Novel massive MIMO channel sounding data applied to deep learning-based indoor positioning",
        "CSI-based positioning in massive MIMO systems using convolutional neural networks",
        "MaMIMO CSI-based positioning using CNNs: Peeking inside the black box",
        "Mhsa-ec: An indoor localization algorithm fusing the multi-head self-attention mechanism and effective csi"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 46 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in CSI-fingerprinting Indoor Localization via Attention-Augmented Residual Convolutional Neural Network, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
